parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Groups

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the group a unit is assigned to.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''group''' object

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]
</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Group]] -  
For dead units, the returned group equals [[grpNull]].
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_playerGrp <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> [[group]] [[player]]</code>

</value></part><part><name>pr</name>=<value> In MP the command is not initialised in functions called by initline or init eventhandlers.

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[local]], [[join]], [[leader]], [[units]], [[allGroups]], [[groupID]], [[setGroupId]], [[setGroupIdGlobal]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 19, 2006 - 12:00</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:jafarin|jafarin]]<dd class="note">
Few rules about group in OFP:R.<br>
1) When last man in group die or is moved to other group, group will be destroyed, and it can't be used anymore.<br>
2) 1st man joined to empty group will be group leader.<br>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
